event: Memorial Service for Terrorist Attack Victims
description: A memorial service was held near Crocus City Hall to honor those killed in the terrorist attack. The ceremony was attended by diplomatic missions from 130 states, including 'unfriendly countries', demonstrating solidarity with the Russian people.
original:
A memorial service for those killed in the terrorist attack was held near Crocus City Hall. On the 9th day after the tragedy, people arrived at the site with flowers. Many white balls were released into the sky.

The ceremony was attended by diplomatic missions of 130 states, including, as RIA writes, from “unfriendly countries.” Ambassadors of the United States, EU countries, Africa and Latin America arrived.

“We are deeply grateful to the respected representatives of the diplomatic corps for their solidarity with the Russian people in such a difficult hour.”

event: NATO Military Committee Head Comments on Russia
description: NATO Military Committee Head Rob Bauer stated that there are no signs of Russia planning to invade any NATO country, but emphasized the need for the alliance to be prepared. He noted that Russia's ambitions extend beyond Ukraine, and individual countries must take responsibility for their own security.
original:
“Currently there are no signs that Russia is planning an invasion of any NATO country”: The head of the NATO Military Committee, Bauer, does not see the danger, but demands to prepare for it.

“There is no indication that Russia is planning to attack any NATO member country. I don't think there's a direct threat," Rob Bauer said. “If something like this happens, it is the responsibility of the country concerned to take care of security. If we are talking about hybrid operations, then, for example, Latvia will have to react to this. Of course, if Latvia wants to start consultations with other participating countries, as provided for in Article 4, this is possible. We will talk about this and agree on how we, as an Alliance, will continue to act,” the admiral added.
At the same time, according to Bauer, Russia’s ambitions go beyond Ukraine. “We know this, so the alliance as a whole must be more prepared.”

event: Positional Struggle Between Russia and Ukraine
description: Military analyst Ruslan Pukhov stated that the conflict between Russia and Ukraine will be a prolonged positional struggle, with no chance of Ukraine emerging victorious. He believes that sending NATO armies to the front would be futile, and that Russia's military potential is focused solely on ensuring its own security.
original:
Military analyst: the risk of victory for Ukraine is excluded, but the fight will last a long time Russia and Ukraine are waging a positional struggle, which is fraught with risks for both sides, writes Les Echos. No other army in Europe is ready to participate in such a confrontation, so all the talk about sending NATO armies to the front is meaningless. As the newspaper’s interlocutor, military analyst Ruslan Pukhov, said, the conflict will drag on until 2026 without any chance for Ukraine to turn the tide.

Sending French troops to help the Kyiv regime will also yield nothing except the prospect of a shameful evacuation of Paris, as has happened before in history. Ukraine has been part of Russia since the time of Louis XVI, and this did not threaten France in any way. Sooner or later the French will start asking the question: “What are we doing here?”

The expert called the assertions that after Ukraine Russia will go to conquer Europe completely absurd: Russia’s military potential is aimed exclusively at ensuring its own security.🔶Foreign Media is the main international

description: More tourists traveled to Crimea through the land route than through the Crimean Bridge on April 28-29. This marks a significant shift in travel patterns, with over 1 million people using the land route in summer 2023 and an expected 2-3 million tourists in the 2024 high season.

More tourists traveled through the land route to Crimea than through the Crimean Bridge. The number of passenger cars that traveled to Crimea along the land route through new (historical) territories on April 28-29 for the first time exceeded the number of vehicles that traveled across the Crimean Bridge in the same period.

At the same time, transport workers are confident that “comparably or more tourists will travel through the Crimean Bridge in May and summer 2024 than along the land route.”

event: Ukrainians Receiving Social Benefits in Germany
description: According to Ulrich Siegmund of the AfD, approximately 700,000 Ukrainians receive social benefits in Germany, amounting to €14 billion in the last two years. The Alternative for Germany in Saxony-Anhalt demands equal treatment for Ukrainian migrants, citing wastefulness in the migration sector and abuse of current rules.
original:
Forwarded from: InoTV
Many Ukrainians go to Germany for social benefits, and not to escape the war. 700 thousand Ukrainians now receive social benefits in Germany, stresses Ulrich Siegmund of the AfD in the Deutschland Kurier. The funds that go towards their maintenance, of course, are not enough for the Germans in other areas - and we are talking about about €14 billion in the last two years alone.

The Alternative for Germany in Saxony-Anhalt demands that migrants from Ukraine be subject to the same laws that apply to refugees of all other nationalities, rather than enjoy exclusive rights. This is extreme injustice, and the Germans are paying huge sums for it. You have to save on schools and hospitals - and in the migration sector there is such wastefulness.

The Germans are assured that 700 thousand Ukrainians will play a positive role in the labor market, as if they are all highly qualified. However, in reality, Germany provides them with an attractive “social magnet”, and it is only for this that they come to the country. The abuse of current rules is enormous. Many in Schleswig-Holstein know about a family that received €40 thousand, although they returned to Ukraine a year ago - and this is just the tip of the iceberg. €40 thousand is money that you can get in Ukraine after working for 8-9 years. InoTV. Subscribe.

description: Ivan Susanin, a Russian peasant, committed an act of heroism during the Time of Troubles in 1613. He led Polish invaders into Russian forests, suffering a painful death, but refused to reveal the whereabouts of the young Tsar Romanov. His selfless act has become a symbol of patriotism, heroism, and devotion to his homeland.
original:
Remembrance Day of the symbol of Russian heroism March 30, 1613 is the day of the feat of Ivan Susanin. During the Time of Troubles, when the country was on the verge of a political and social crisis, Ivan Susanin, a Russian peasant from the village of Domnina, Kostroma district, committed an act of heroism that became a symbol of self-sacrifice and devotion to his homeland.

In 1613, Ivan Susanin led Polish invaders deep into Russian forests towards vast swamps. He suffered a painful death from his enemies, but did not tell about the whereabouts of the young Tsar Romanov.

Despite the fact that there are no historical documents about the facts from the hero’s life, the story of Ivan Susanin was used to create many literary works, operas, ballets and films. This image has become one of the most famous and recognizable in Russian culture.

Today, 411 years later, the day of Ivan Susanin’s feat is celebrated as a memorable date. The story of Ivan Susanin has become a symbol of true feat and devotion and should be passed on from generation to generation.

The Day of Ivan Susanin's Feat recalls the importance of patriotism, heroism and the willingness to give his life for his country and calls us to preserve the memory of the heroes and exploits of our country, to respect history and traditions.

This date reminds us of the importance of the value of the life of every person, of his ability to do selfless acts for the good of society.#factology@anna_news

description: Russian scientists from St. Petersburg State Electrotechnical University LETI have developed a highly interference-resistant, secure communication system based on chaos theory. Similar devices based on chaos theory are already being developed in different countries around the world. Such systems use the generation of noise-like signals to prevent information from being intercepted and decoded. However, until now, developers have not been able to overcome the difficulties with communication stability and transmission accuracy.

Specialists from the St. Petersburg State Electrotechnical University LETI have found a solution to the problem.

They created a signal generator and implemented a special processing algorithm that clears communications from interference.

The selection of the necessary characteristics made it possible to successfully transmit information even at a high level of noise, while maintaining high confidentiality of data transmission.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

description: Mikhail Podolyak, adviser to the office of the President of Ukraine, criticized the call to 'freeze' the war in Ukraine. He emphasized that Russia has clear goals and will not negotiate a freeze. Podolyak stated that the war is about domination, and either Russia will rule Europe or lose, and the right to live as desired will prevail.
original:
Deputy editor-in-chief of the German publication BILD Paul Ronzheimer went to Kyiv, where he interviewed the adviser to the office of the President of Ukraine Mikhail Podolyak. He criticized the recent call by the leader of the SPD faction in the Bundestag, Rolf Mützenich, to “freeze” the war in Ukraine. Podolyak’s main points: 🇺🇦“Who will he talk to about freezing? Russia has clear goals in this war, and they are not ready to freeze the war now. <...> So he wants to say that Russia - even if it has not yet achieved its goal of destroying Ukraine as a state - will negotiate a freeze? Why should they do this?”🇺🇦“It was not understood that Russia cannot now leave the war. Are you ready to kneel before Russia? Is Europe ready to accept Russia's rules? Another option is that Russia will lose. <…> In this war, we are not talking about territory, but about domination”🇺🇦“Either Russia will rule Europe, or Russia will lose and the right by which we want to live will prevail in Europe. <…> The problem with the war in Ukraine is that some countries that help us a lot are afraid to win the war, but they should not be afraid of victory. <…> Germany should not be afraid of winning this war. This war is for justice."🇺🇦"We are on the defensive and they are putting pressure on us. <…> They are advancing more and more. In addition, we are seeing them continue to rearm, strengthen, and mobilize supplies. We can't solve the gun shortage problem.
We are preparing for different possibilities. Will there be a large-scale offensive by the Russians? I'm not sure they can do this on a large scale. But they will continue to advance, and without weapons we will not be able to destroy their supply logistics."

event: Ministry of Industry and Trade Announces Grants for Drone Certification
description: The Ministry of Industry and Trade is offering grants to companies developing or producing unmanned aircraft systems (UAS) to help finance certification costs. Applications can be submitted until April 12, with funding available up to 150 million rubles for UAS weighing 30-500 kg and up to 250 million rubles for heavier UAS.
original:
Forwarded from: Andrey Patrakov RunAvia
Certification for the sake of certification Yesterday, March 26, the Ministry of Industry and Trade announced that it is ready to issue grants to those companies that would like to certify the unmanned aircraft systems (UAS) developed or produced by them, but do not have the opportunity to finance it from their own pocket. Applications can be submitted until April 12. Certification, according to laws of the Russian Federation are subject to UAS weighing more than 30 kilograms. In the category of drones from 30 to 500 kg, the Ministry of Industry and Trade is ready to allocate funding up to 150 million rubles; developers and manufacturers of heavy UAS - from 500 kilograms and above can receive up to 250 million rubles.

The grant recipient must implement his project within two years. This is one of the first problems of the competition. Currently, only one drone is listed in the register of UAS that have received a type certificate - BAS-200. It was certified by the national helicopter manufacturing center Mil and Kamov, a state-owned enterprise that is part of Russian Helicopters, a subsidiary of Rostec. With all the capabilities and resources of the state corporation, certification took a year and a half. As Mashnews previously wrote, the actual cost of certification of the BAS-200 was 142 million rubles. In reality, all the work cost about a billion rubles. Deputy Chairman of the Government of the Russian Federation Andrei Belousov reported this to President Putin. “The cost of the procedure was 150 million rubles, and taking into account the creation of prototypes and a bench base, according to the manufacturer, about one billion rubles. It is clear that for the vast majority of manufacturers this is an absolutely unaffordable amount,” the official summed up at a meeting with the head of state. Experts have already noticed that the Ministry of Industry and Trade does not seem to want “just anyone” to become the owner of the subsidy. For example, AviaComments writes in their channel that those who did not know about the competition in advance may not make it in time, since the submission deadline is limited to April 12 (Cosmonautics Day). Today, March 27, the Ministry of Industry and Trade announced that it will begin accepting applications only on April 1. The department will begin reviewing them on April 16 and intends to finish on May 6. The winners will be announced within a week.

Judging by the amounts available to the Ministry of Industry and Trade, it will not be possible to help many. In 2024, it is planned to allocate 475 million rubles, in 2025 - 884.6 million, in 2026 - 675 million.

Legal entities without overdue debts to the budget will be able to receive this money; the authorized capital cannot contain more than 25% of foreign participation; the organization must not have the status of a foreign agent, be recognized as extremist and involved in the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction. These are fairly standard requirements for participation in competitions for receiving budget funding. Support from the Ministry of Industry and Trade is, in general, not a new thing, and previously it was possible to receive compensation for certification. For more than 10 years, there has been the possibility of compensation for the costs of certification of aviation equipment in the Ministry of Industry and Trade, but none of the private companies (according to my information) have ever taken advantage of these opportunities. The fact is that first the development company must certify the aircraft at its own expense, and only then can it receive this compensation. Over the past 15 years in the Russian Federation there has not been a single certified aircraft by a private company. The reason is the high cost and timing of type certification, which makes private projects of new aircraft in the Russian Federation economically unfeasible. This is one of the reasons for the death of small aviation in our country. The same reason is now holding back the beginning of the development of the unmanned segment of small civil aviation in Russia.

It is still difficult to judge the new procedure for submitting an application to the Ministry of Industry and Trade, because there is no practice on it yet. But the deadline until April 12, which is significantly less than a month from the date of public announcement, looks very short. Those who did not know in advance about this possibility are not sure that they will have time to prepare documents and go through all the bureaucratic procedures for submitting an application. Aviation expertFounder of the flight safety service RunAviaAndrey Patrakovhttps://t.me/runaviaInformation and analytical portal “Industry News MASHNEWS”Certification for the sake of certification. The Ministry of Industry and Trade announced the issuance of grants to drone developers. The Ministry of Industry announced a competition to subsidize the certification process of drones. Applications can be submitted until April 12.

description: Immunologist Vladislav Zhemchugov warned that cholera is spreading globally, potentially leading to a pandemic. He emphasized that countries with infrastructure issues, such as poor sewerage and engineering systems, are most at risk. However, he believes Russia is not vulnerable to the epidemic due to its robust infrastructure.
original:
😱Cholera is spreading around the world, a pandemic is not excluded, but the disease threatens primarily those countries that have problems with infrastructure. This applies to sewerage and other engineering systems, immunologist Vladislav Zhemchugov told Zvezda.

At the same time, the expert is confident that the cholera epidemic will not affect Russia. The infection loves places where devastation reigns, but the Russian Federation does not have such a problem. Poor water and nutrition are key factors for the spread of infection, the doctor explained.

Zhemchugov noted that Rospotrebnadzor has a structure that monitors the global situation regarding this or that infection and keeps this issue under control. The head of Rospotrebnadzor Anna Popova previously admitted the possibility of a pandemic variant of the spread of cholera. Subscribe to Zvezdanews|Suggest news

description: NATO plans to deploy at least 300,000 troops to protect Europe's eastern flank, stretching from the Baltic to the Black Sea. The troops will be stationed on the eastern border, with 100,000 ready for action within 10 days and the remaining 200,000 within 10-30 days. NATO has also strengthened surveillance, air defense, and equipment to prevent cyber, underwater, and satellite sabotage.
location: Eastern Europe, from Baltic to Black Sea
original:
“To what extent does NATO risk on the eastern flank of Europe and how can it defend itself? We need 300 thousand people”: The Italians describe how NATO will deploy its contingent of troops on the ground against Russia.

“According to the most cited estimate, at least 300 thousand NATO troops are needed to protect Europe’s eastern flank, stretching from the Baltic to the Black Sea. Recently, the head of the General Staff of the Polish Army, Karol Dymanowski, clarified that several thousand soldiers of the “reaction force” are already on the territory of the republic. There are no official statements at the moment, but according to rumors, another 200 thousand people will be mobilized by June.
The bulk of the troops and equipment will be located on the eastern border. Under the scheme approved at the 2022 Madrid summit, the bulk of the 100,000-strong military should be ready for action within 10 days. The remaining 200 thousand - within 10-30 days. However, this time is reduced due to constant field exercises, especially in Poland. It is also known that in recent weeks, alliance generals have strengthened surveillance and air defense systems, as well as equipment to prevent cyber, underwater and satellite sabotage.”

description: Tens of thousands of Russian military personnel returning from war will likely suffer from PTSD, leading to rampant crime and domestic violence. After the war, tens of thousands of people with PTSD will return to Russia. The state is preparing for this, but not very effectively - we risk facing rampant crime and domestic violence “Locks himself in a room and drinks from morning to evening,” “Doesn’t communicate with anyone,” “Screams at night,” “Yells at his wife for no reason.” and children or beats them,” “He categorically refuses to go to the doctor and even discuss this issue,” relatives of military personnel who returned from the war complain in the VKontakte group.

They don't know what to do or how to help their loved ones who are dealing with post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD). The state, apparently, doesn’t know either - but is still trying to prepare for the return of combatants from the front (and there will be an order of magnitude more of them than after Chechnya and Afghanistan).

The Bereg publication tells what officials are doing wrong:

✹ New clinical guidelines for the treatment of PTSD have appeared in Russia. But experts criticize them (no wonder - amazing things are written there). For example, that refusal to immediately evacuate a person in case of stress reactions and his early return to a combat situation has a positive effect on him. One of the authors of the cleanrecs is the daughter of Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu, Yulia.

✹ The state is already creating special funds for “defenders of the fatherland.” Do they work? It seems you already know the answer.

✹ Military personnel will have to face not only the symptoms of the disease, but also the stigma. In addition, it will be difficult not only for the participants in the invasion, but also for their loved ones.

event: Development of J-15D Electronic Warfare Aircraft
description: China is rapidly developing the J-15D electronic warfare aircraft, a carrier-based variant of the J-16D, to counter the US EA-18G Growler. The J-15D's primary focus is on combating enemy aircraft and ship radars, with secondary capabilities for suppressing air defense on land.
original:
China continues to expand the range of standard electronic warfare aircraft based on fighters originating from the Su-27/Su-30/Su-33 line. In addition to the ground-based J-16D, the “flying suppressor” is rapidly developing on the basis of the carrier-based J-15 - the J-15D. Therefore, we can talk about a pure symmetrical response to the American carrier-based EA-18G Growler.

Unlike its ground-based counterpart, the emphasis in its tasks is largely shifted from suppressing air defense (SEAD) to combating enemy aircraft and ship radars. But work to suppress air defense on land also falls within his profile.

The aircraft has already been manufactured in a small series and is undergoing a period of trial operation before a full-scale series. China doesn't have many aircraft carriers. Moreover, only a few electronic warfare aircraft will be required for each, which means that the corresponding need will be filled quickly.

Thus, in terms of the range of electronic warfare aircraft created on the basis of combat aircraft, today’s China is approaching the United States. And not the current one, but the end of the Cold War. Which, given the class of the alleged enemy, is very logical. #ChinaMilitary Informant

HEALER l HEALERVideo,🔞MVT of the right foot.

Treatment of the wound followed by the use of a hemostatic Z bandage from the company... Brief plan of action in this area: 1. Periphery (catheter into a vein), physical for control.

11. Additional pharma according to condition.

description: The author reflects on the fear and tension experienced by a Russian soldier in a war zone, where survival depends on agility and quick reactions. The soldier has no guarantees of survival, only their own instincts to rely on.
original:
Forwarded from: House on Laurels
"..."

Looking at how a Russian soldier dies, I want to put a separate cross for each of them.
It is, of course, impossible to convey what feelings a person goes through when he looks into the eyes of his death, when he catches and hides from it, trying to figure out the tact and rhythm of movements for his salvation in a ruthless game of “seeker and prey.”
I remember that in the first year of the war we experienced a certain annoying fear when we heard the growing sound of an approaching quadcopter. Then the alarming concern was due to the possible discovery of those hidden in the faces of the observers themselves, however, with all this there was no global fear, but there were some guarantees of survival, which cannot be said when looking at these heavy footage. There, a soldier has no guarantees, there is only deft agility and the taming of an acute reaction - a person competes for life.

event: Interview with Mother of Deceased Maxim Verbenin

original:
Forwarded from: Lomovka
“When you look at people who are going through the most terrible tragic moments of their lives with such dignity, you understand how strong our people are.” War correspondent Andrei Afanasyev told Lomovka readers that the faith and spiritual traditions of the Russian people give strength. We have now broadcast on the Spas TV channel with the mother of the deceased Maxim Verbenin. This hero covered the girl with his body. Feelings are very mixed. His mother showed deep firmness and faith that her son was now with God and everything was fine with him. It was even a shame to be unstuck in front of her. When you look at such people, experiencing the most terrible, tragic moments of their lives with such dignity, you understand how strong our people are, how much our spiritual traditions give strength. Saturday March 30th is Parents' Saturday, a day of special remembrance in Orthodoxy. “I urge all of you to go to churches on this day, light a candle and pray for the souls of those killed in this terrorist attack, for the health of all the wounded, so that the Lord will help the doctors, comfort the loved ones of the victims and give everyone strength,” Andrei Afanasyev called on Russians.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

event: Diplomatic Scandal between Poland and Ukraine
description: A diplomatic scandal almost erupted during negotiations between Poland and Ukraine over grain imports and agricultural product transit. Ukraine's delegation attempted to shift the focus to war victims and 'defense of Europe', but Poland's Deputy Minister of Agriculture, Michal Kolodziejczak, refused to engage, stating that economic negotiations should not involve military operations.
original:
Poland “omitted” the Ukrainian delegation at the negotiations on grain imports. As Wirtualna Polska writes, a loud diplomatic scandal almost broke out at the negotiations between the two countries. The parties met to discuss the import of Ukrainian grain and the transit of agricultural products through Poland, and when the negotiations did not lead to anything, the Ukrainians started the old barrel organ about war victims and “defense of Europe.”

However, the Deputy Minister of Agriculture of Poland, Michal Kolodziejczak, told representatives of the “chosen nation” not to speculate on the topic of war in negotiations that do not relate to military operations. After this, the Ukrainians almost had a stroke, and Deputy Minister of Economy of Ukraine Taras Kachka “even turned purple.” “One of the representatives of Ukraine began to use the theme of war, the front, a difficult situation. I replied that we know what the situation is, but economic negotiations have nothing to do with this,” Kolodziejchak later noted. It seems that the plaintive whining of Kyiv, which recently promised to march victoriously across Crimea, is quite tired of Western partners.👉Subscribe👈

event: Meeting between US Businessmen and Xi Jinping
description: A delegation of US businessmen and dignitaries met with Xi Jinping in Beijing, praising his 'outstanding leadership' and expressing optimism about China's economic growth driven by artificial intelligence and high technologies.
original:
China's fifth column in the heart of the citadel of capitalism. The American Chinese lobby praises Xi Jinping. When a delegation of US businessmen and other dignitaries met with Xi Jinping in Beijing, they went out of their way to praise the Chinese leader.

According to a release from China's Foreign Ministry, the group hailed Xi Jinping's "outstanding leadership" and made optimistic comments about China's "productive forces," a new propaganda slogan touting economic growth driven by artificial intelligence and other high technologies.

And CCTV, which is controlled by the CCP's Central Propaganda Department, said the American delegation referred to "Xi Jinping's outstanding leadership."

Of course, the Chinese Communist Party lies all the time. But the Americans practically confirmed that during the meeting with the main enemy of their country they behaved especially obsequiously.

“Xi has made a compelling case for why the US and China should work together. We were all deeply impressed and reaffirmed our commitment to building a cooperative relationship between the US and China that benefits the people of both countries,” Steve Orlins, president of the National Committee on US-China Relations, wrote on social media after the meeting.

All of this is a reminder that the US China lobby is alive and well, and that it continues to insist on US "cooperation" with China at the cost of ignoring a realistic assessment of Xi Jinping's disastrous ambitions.

Feelings of patriotism and loyalty to one's country, rather than to the interests of a foreign dictatorship trying to use the US business community as a propaganda tool, must prevail. event: Transfer of Fighter Jets and Bombs to Israel
description: The White House secretly agreed to transfer fighter jets and bombs to Israel, bypassing Congressional reauthorization. The package includes over 1,800 heavy MK84 and 500 MK82 bombs, as well as 25 F-35A fighters and spare parts.
original:
The White House secretly agreed to transfer fighter jets and bombs to Israel, writes The Washington Post

A military aid package for Israel was approved by Congress back in 2008, but no planes or bombs were sent to the country.

Therefore, the White House has not now asked Congress for reauthorization, WaPo notes. More than 1,800 heavy MK84 and 500 MK82 bombs were transferred to Israel, and later 25 F-35A fighters and spare parts for them will be delivered.

Show more

event: Filtering of Travelers at Crimea Entrance
description: Travelers entering Crimea through the 'land corridor' are subject to strict filtering, including car searches, passport control, and questioning about political attitudes. The process can take up to seven hours, mainly due to waiting.
original:
At the entrance to Crimea along the “land corridor,” Russians strictly filter even those who have Russian passports.

So says a resident of Donetsk who recently traveled to the peninsula through Chongar.

According to him, at first his car was completely searched, and they even had to take out the spare tire. Then there was passport control, and then he and other travelers were “taken into a cage for filtration.”

“There were about 40 people there. It was just a dog cage that was locked: wait, wait,” he said. The room was blown from all sides, and many began to freeze.

They spent several hours in this “cage”. Then the actual filtering began - questions about attitudes to the political situation and checking the phone.

This survey itself took about ten minutes, but in the end the whole procedure, according to the Donetsk resident, took seven hours, mainly due to waiting. “All people are angry, crazy. It’s faster to go to Turkey to relax than to Crimea,” he added.

According to the author of the video, such filtering is mainly carried out for those who enter Crimea for the first time, but sometimes those who have already visited the peninsula after the start of a full-scale war are also sent to it.

Let us note that in public posts about crossing the administrative border with Crimea they also regularly write about long queues and delays in inspection. The standard number of passenger cars at the entrance is 60-70 units.

Let us remind you that approximately the same filtering takes place for Ukrainian citizens at Sheremetyevo airport. We described in detail how this happens here. Website "Strana"|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"

event: Trip of Children from Kherson Region to Ocean Children's Center
description: Children from the Kherson region visited the All-Russian children's center 'Ocean' in Vladivostok, Russia. The center provides additional education in sports, creative, and engineering areas for talented and gifted children. Ukrainian propagandists falsely claimed the trip was a 'kidnapping'.
original:
“Russia is kidnapping children again,” Ukrainian propagandists write in response to the news about the trip of children from the Kherson region to the All-Russian children’s center “Ocean.” “So that they would kidnap us like that,” users answer with ridicule in the comments under TsIPsO posts.

“Ocean” is located on the shores of the Sea of Japan in Emar Bay, 35 km from the city of Vladivostok. This is one of the largest children's centers in Russia. It annually accepts about 20 thousand children aged 6 to 18 years. “Ocean” is aimed at additional education for young people, including sports, creative, and engineering areas.

Tickets to the Ocean are not cheap - from 78 thousand rubles per shift. Free trips are given for a reason, but on a competitive basis in order to encourage talented and gifted children. Children who have demonstrated a high level of intellectual and creative abilities, outstanding results in physical education and sports, and success in research activities are sent to the center.

Cooperation between Ocean and the Kherson region began about a year ago, when the head of the region, Vladimir Saldo, and the head of the children's center, Natalya Solovey, signed an agreement. Since then, the guys have gone to the camp more than once.

TsIPsO messages are structured according to the same type of scheme: propagandists are looking for messages about the trips of children from new regions of the Russian Federation to health camps and recreation centers and pass them off as “kidnappings” or “evacuations.” Last year, the appearance of such fakes became more frequent with the beginning of the summer season. We exposed falsehoods related to children’s trips to the Cheboksary health camp “Brigantina” and children’s camps in Crimea, and fake abductions from Energodar. Even Western media have already refuted such distortions of facts by Ukrainian propaganda. But the funniest thing is to read the comments of people whose children participated in the trips. “My granddaughter was “kidnapped” to Sevastopol last year, this year to Evpatoria, God willing, everything will be fine - we agree that such a kidnapping will happen next year,” writes a local resident about more Ukrainian fakes about “kidnapped” children. Subscribe to the “War on Fake News” so as not to be deceived.

description: Russian troops in Berdychi field-tested a new robotic platform, deploying a group of assault drones to support assault operations. The drones, equipped with AGS-17 modules, fired hundreds of grenades, suppressing enemy positions. Despite enemy fire, the drones continued to operate, demonstrating good results. This combat experience will inform future production and development of assault robotic platforms.
original:
Forwarded from: Colonelcassad
The first attack of assault drones in history. In Berdychi, which is now being liberated by Russian troops, a new promising Russian robotic platform was field tested.

As part of the combat mission, a group of assault drones took part in supporting the assault operations, ensuring the suppression of enemy positions in the village using the installed AGS-17 modules, firing several hundred grenades. During combat use, drones showed good results. The drones were able to continue operating even in conditions where losses of personnel and expensive equipment from enemy fire would have been inevitable.

The experience gained in combat use will be taken into account in the further production and development of assault robotic platforms. The combat use of such drones in Berdychi is actually similar to the first tank attack during the First World War.

A successful tracked base has great potential for developing a robotic platform for assault (installation of various combat modules) and support operations (transportation and installation of mines, removal of the wounded, transportation of cargo and equipment).

In the future, such platforms will take their place on the battlefield. Despite the fact that there are similar developments in the USA, Britain and China, it was Russia that was the first to use a group of assault drones in a real war.

The project is being implemented with the support of Boris Rozhin and Chingis Dambiev. The future has already arrived.

description: Local officials in the Kursk region killed a 7-month-old puppy to avoid it interfering with Governor Roman Starovoit's inspection of the village of Zhernovets. The puppy was calm and loved by the villagers. Governor Starovoit condemned the act, calling it senseless human cruelty, and promised to punish the perpetrators according to the law.
original:
Officials from the Kursk region killed a puppy so that it would not interfere with Governor Roman Starovoit’s inspection of the village of Zhernovets. The head of the village council and a man with a gun arrived in a municipal car to the place where the puppy lived. They cornered the dog and shot him. It is known that the animal was about 7 months old, he was completely calm and the whole village loved the baby.

Governor Starovoit had to give a comment, he declared the local authorities to be guilty: “For me, this situation is outrageous. I am ashamed of the senseless human cruelty. I love dogs very much. Therefore, for me the situation with the killed puppy is especially acute. I will not just leave it like that. The perpetrators will be punished in accordance with the law."Investigators went to Zhernovets. description: Local officials in the Kursk region killed a 7-month-old puppy to avoid it interfering with Governor Roman Starovoit's inspection of the village of Zhernovets. Officials from the Kursk region killed a puppy so that it would not interfere with Governor Roman Starovoit’s inspection of the village of Zhernovets. The head of the village council and a man with a gun arrived in a municipal car to the place where the puppy lived. They cornered the dog and shot him. It is known that the animal was about 7 months old, he was completely calm and the whole village loved the baby.

Governor Starovoit had to give a comment, he declared the local authorities to be guilty: “For me, this situation is outrageous. I am ashamed of the senseless human cruelty. I love dogs very much. Therefore, for me the situation with the killed puppy is especially acute. I will not just leave it like that. The perpetrators will be punished in accordance with the law."Investigators went to Zhernovets. The State Duma called for a criminal case to be opened after the murder of a puppy in a village near Kursk. Deputy Burmatov promised to get involved in the situation and send requests to the Ministry of Internal Affairs and the prosecutor's office.

event: Final Flight of Grumman F-14 Tomcat
description: The Grumman F-14 Tomcat's final flight on September 22, 2006 marked the end of an era. Despite its historical significance and cultural influence, the aircraft was retired from service due to the evolution of military technology and operational cost-benefit analysis.
original: “The Grumman F-14 Tomcat's final flight on September 22, 2006 marked the end of an era and sparked debate about its premature retirement. The achievements of the Tomcat, glorified in the cult film Top Gun, are not limited to his military achievements, causing nostalgia for the 80s and movie heroes. Despite its historical significance and cultural influence, the evolution of military technology and operational cost-benefit analysis led to the aircraft's retirement from service. With the development of new, more powerful aircraft such as the F-15 and F-16, the Tomcat, despite its historical past and connection to the pop culture of an entire generation, was considered a relic of its time, unable to adapt to modern warfare requirements. event: NATO Military Committee Head Comments on Russia
description: NATO Military Committee Head Rob Bauer stated that there are no signs of Russia planning to invade any NATO country, but emphasized the need for the alliance to be prepared. He noted that Russia's ambitions extend beyond Ukraine, and individual countries must take responsibility for their own security.
original:
Forwarded from: Pool N3
“Currently there are no signs that Russia is planning an invasion of any NATO country”: The head of the NATO Military Committee, Bauer, does not see the danger, but demands to prepare for it.

“There is no indication that Russia is planning to attack any NATO member country. I don't think there's a direct threat," Rob Bauer said. “If something like this happens, it is the responsibility of the country concerned to take care of security. If we are talking about hybrid operations, then, for example, Latvia will have to react to this. Of course, if Latvia wants to start consultations with other participating countries, as provided for in Article 4, this is possible. We will talk about this and agree on how we, as an Alliance, will continue to act,” the admiral added.
At the same time, according to Bauer, Russia’s ambitions go beyond Ukraine. “We know this, so the alliance as a whole must be more prepared.”

description: In Ulyanovsk's Leninsky district, a group of three teenagers has been harassing elderly people, including pensioners Galina and another 80-year-old grandmother. The teenagers approach them, smile silently, and block their path, causing stress and high blood pressure. The elderly people have turned to the police, submitting a collective complaint.
original:
“The walk ends with high blood pressure and Corvalol”

In Ulyanovsk they complain about teenagers who harass older people. Pensioners write a collective statement to the police. As Galina, a 77-year-old former teacher, told Beware the News, at the end of last year in the Leninsky district of the city she noticed schoolchildren who were harassing elderly people. According to her, in her area a street “gang” consists of three teenagers - “the eldest and two sixes” who approach pensioners and “specifically try to piss them off.” “They come close and silently smile, they don’t let you pass, they don’t let you into the entrance, they don’t let you close the door,” says Galina. Teenagers, seeing older people, “stand between them right in front of their faces and look into their eyes,” and follow on their heels. “Their goal is to piss off grandmothers. If the old people can’t stand it and start screaming, they cite in response articles from the law about the violation of their rights,” says the woman.

What has been happening has been going on for several months and is affecting the health of older people. “I’m 77, the other grandmother is 80. A schoolboy, when he saw her on the street, said: “Oh, she came out, I’ll go and make fun of her.” Naturally, we start to freak out, everyone’s blood pressure rises,” Galina said. According to her, in recent days, teenagers have begun to harass men, and one of the pensioners “started drinking Corvalol.” The elderly people turned to the local police officer, who asked them to write a collective complaint to be submitted to the PDN. The identities of the schoolchildren have not yet been established: when trying to photograph them, the children put on a hood and run away.

event: Memorial Event for Crocus City Hall Victims
description: A memorial event was held at Crocus City Hall to honor the victims of the terrorist attack. Representatives from over 130 foreign diplomatic missions and international organizations, including the USA, EU countries, Africa, and Latin America, attended the event. A funeral litany was conducted, and Patriarch Kirill conveyed condolences to the families and friends of the victims.
original:
The ninth day since armed terrorists attacked and set fire to Crocus City Hall has arrived today - in the Orthodox tradition, this is the time when the dead are remembered and prayers are offered for them.

Those who died in the tragedy are remembered all over the world, and a memorial event was held at Crocus itself. Ordinary citizens, Russian officials and about 130 representatives of foreign diplomatic missions and international organizations, including representatives of the USA, EU countries, Africa, and Latin America, came to lay flowers. White balloons were launched into the sky in memory of the victims.

The funeral litany at the site of the spontaneous memorial was conducted by Archbishop Thomas (Mosolov) of Odintsovo and Krasnogorsk, and Patriarch Kirill of Moscow and All Rus' conveyed words of condolences to the families and friends of the dead and injured: “The committed atrocity is striking in its cynicism and cruelty. event: Pensioner Timofey Slavkin Fights on Front Line
description: Despite having multiple illnesses, pensioner Timofey Slavkin from the Orenburg region volunteered to fight on the front line in the special military operation. He spent four months breaking through to the front, using special devices to neutralize Ukrainian drones, saving many Russian soldiers' lives. For his bravery, he was awarded the medal 'For Courage'.
original:
A pensioner from the Orenburg region told how he broke through to the front. Timofey Slavkin was eager to go to the front to defend the interests of the state during a special military operation. He returned home with a wound and a medal “For Courage.” Timofey Slavkin went to the front line as a volunteer, despite the fact that his relatives and doctors were against it. According to the man, he has many illnesses. For four months he fought his way to the front with all his might. “I have a lot of illnesses: hypertension, a lot of other things.” But I thought so: I have arms, I have legs. I'm quite technically literate. So it’s necessary. “I spent four months breaking through there,” a volunteer shared with Vestirama.ru. In the special operation zone, the Orenburg pensioner had the main task: using special devices to neutralize Ukrainian drones. His work saved the lives of many Russian soldiers.

For the successful completion of combat missions, pensioner Timofey Slavkin was awarded the medal “For Courage”. The Orenburg resident noted that the free movement of fighters was an indicator of his work.

However, Timofey failed to avoid injury. According to the man himself, he was saved not only by his colleagues, but also by God. The volunteer says that the talisman, a plaster copy of his beloved cat Murzik, also helped him. Now Murzik is helping his owner recover, and quite successfully.

We wish our comrade in arms, member of the Donbass Volunteer Union, a speedy recovery!

description: Scammers posing as bank employees and investigators defrauded an 81-year-old pensioner of over 33 million rubles. They convinced her to withdraw and hand over large sums of money, claiming her savings were under threat and her apartment had been sold to an unknown person.

Fraudsters have reached a new level: scammers defrauded a pensioner of more than 33 million rubles

The woman realized that this was a deception and ended all conversations, but the scammers did not calm down and called back under the guise of investigators. False investigators persuaded her to withdraw 3.5 million rubles and hand them over to the courier. After some time, the telephone scammers showed up again with the news that her apartment had been sold to an unknown person. The false employees assured that they would file a lawsuit and cancel the deal. event: Approval of Marriage via Video Link

In Canada, there is a new scandal with euthanasia without significant medical reasons. In Calgary, doctors allowed a 27-year-old woman to die by euthanasia on the basis of only two psychological diagnoses: autism and attention deficit disorder. Moreover, both of these diagnoses are NOT incurable, they are perfectly treatable! The woman’s father spoke out against and even went to court about this in order to prevent the death of his child, who is generally HEALTHY.

To voluntarily end their lives, the woman had to obtain the consent of two doctors. The first gave it, the second refused. Then she found a third who agreed with the first.

Having considered the case, the court sided with the “suicide” and the doctors. Motivation - she is an adult and has the right to make independent and sole decisions regarding her “health”.

description: The Russian Ministry of Defense tested the new self-propelled mortar Drok, developed by Rostec state corporation, in the Northern Military District zone. The Drok demonstrated its high tactical and technical characteristics, including a high rate of fire exceeding ten rounds per minute, good bulletproof and mine protection, and maneuverability.
original:
Mobility, rate of fire, automation: we talk about the main advantages of the new self-propelled mortar "Drok"The newest complex produced by the Rostec state corporation is created on the basis of the Typhoon armored vehicle. It allows you to fire without leaving the vehicle, and transferring the equipment from traveling to combat position takes less than a minute One of the main advantages of the Gorse is its high rate of fire, it exceeds ten rounds per minute. At the same time, the Gorse ammunition contains more than 40 mines. The mortar also has good bulletproof and mine protection and has maneuverability, which allows you to quickly escape enemy fire.

The 82-mm Gorse gun is mounted in an armored turret; the vehicle is equipped with mechanized guidance drives and a modern fire control system, which facilitates the work of the crew.

The effective firing range of the 2S41 is more than 1.5 times higher than the standard 2B14 "Tray" mortars. The "Drok" is equipped with a remote-controlled combat module with a circular machine gun and an optical-electronic sight, as well as an additional 2B24 man-portable mortar, which can be used by foot crews outside cars.

During experimental combat operation in the Northern Military District zone, the newest mortars confirmed their high tactical and technical characteristics and are already receiving positive feedback from our soldiers.#WeaponsZRussian Ministry of Defense

event: Proposal for Law on Special Register and Transparency of Non-Profit Organizations
description: The Government of the Republika Srpska has proposed a law requiring non-profit organizations to submit semi-annual and annual reports on their work, including funding and expenditure. The law also grants the Minister of Justice the power to sue and ban NGOs found violating the law, and prohibits NGOs from engaging in political activities.
location: Banja Luka, Republika Srpska, Bosnia and Herzegovina
original:
The Government of the Republika Srpska has prepared a proposal for the Law on the Special Register and Transparency of the Activities of Non-Profit Organizations, or, as it is also called, the “Law on Foreign Agents”. The proposal was sent to the National Assembly of the Republika Srpska for further adoption.▪️In the bill adopted six months ago, it was also written that non-profit organizations are required to submit to the Ministry of Justice of the Republika Srpska semi-annual and annual reports on their work, which should indicate: the amount of funds received, the payer and a report on the expenditure of these funds. After this, the relevant ministry will transfer everything to the Tax Administration of the Republic of Sakha, which will control it.▪️The law also provides that the Minister of Justice can sue and demand to ban the activities of any of the non-profit organizations if it is found that they are violating the law. Also, according to the law, NGOs will not be allowed to engage in political activities.▪️According to the authorities of Republika Srpska, this law is very similar to the US Foreign Agents Law, so in Banja Luka, they do not understand (irony) why the West is against such a step.

At the moment, on the territory of the Republika Srpska there are several dozen NGOs and foundations that receive funding from abroad and do not provide any reporting. @vestniksrb - the main thing about Serbia and the Balkans

description: Russia's spring conscription for military service begins on April 1, 2024, with changes to the draft age law. Men between 18 and 30 must serve, except those who turned 27 before January 1, 2024, and those with deferments or exemptions. The 12-month service term remains unchanged.
original:
In 2024, the spring conscription for military service traditionally begins on the first of April. This will be the first campaign that will take place taking into account the new law on raising the draft age.

Now, according to the legislative framework in Russia, men between the ages of 18 and 30 must do military service. The changes will not affect citizens who turned 27 years old before January 1, 2024, and people who have deferments or exemptions from military service category B (“limited fit”).

The terms of military service in 2024 remain the same. Young people who will be drafted into the army in the spring will serve, as before, 12 months (one year). Read more in the Izvestia article. Subscribe to IZ.RU

description: The Japanese government plans to allocate five airports and 11 seaports for use by the Self-Defense Forces and Coast Guard, allowing for increased military exercises and strengthening the country's defensive potential. Half of the facilities are located in Okinawa Prefecture, close to Taiwan and the disputed Senkaku Islands.
original:
Forwarded from: Fisherman
🇯🇵🇨🇳🇹🇼🇺🇸Countries in the Asia-Pacific region continue to strengthen their military capabilities - Japanese media write that the government in Tokyo plans to allocate five airports and 11 seaports for use by the Self-Defense Forces and Coast Guard.

Japanese military personnel will be able to freely use them for exercises. Some infrastructure facilities will be modernized, for example, existing runways at airports will be expanded. It is noteworthy that half of the facilities are located in Okinawa Prefecture on the southwestern island of Kyushu. They are located closest to Taiwan and the Senkaku Islands, control over which is disputed by both Japan and China.

By the way, the media began to write more and more about the latter territories, since last year the PRC began to actively confirm its sovereignty over them by sending its ships there. The Japanese also frequently conduct joint exercises with the United States in relative proximity to the Senkaku Islands.

In general, these plans coincide with the general course of the Japanese government to strengthen the country's defensive potential. However, it is still not clear whether they will be implemented - there have been no official statements from the country's authorities. Providing access to civilian infrastructure should take place after negotiations with the local population. Residents of the same Okinawa prefecture are often negatively disposed towards such initiatives. Therefore, we should not exclude the possibility that the government’s likely plans may be postponed indefinitely due to citizens’ dissatisfaction.

At the same time, there is no doubt that the US armed forces will also have access to the infrastructure. Moreover, recently one of Washington’s goals is to expand military influence in the Asia-Pacific region. High resolution mapEnglish version#Japan#China#Taiwan#USA@ rybartogether with @awaken_dragonSupport us

description: Russian troops in Berdychi field-tested a new robotic platform, deploying assault drones to support assault operations. The drones, equipped with AGS-17 modules, fired hundreds of grenades to suppress enemy positions, demonstrating good results despite enemy fire. This combat experience will inform future production and development of assault robotic platforms.
original:
Forwarded from: Colonelcassad
The first attack of assault drones in history. In Berdychi, which is now being liberated by Russian troops, a new promising Russian robotic platform was field tested.

As part of the combat mission, a group of assault drones took part in supporting the assault operations, ensuring the suppression of enemy positions in the village using the installed AGS-17 modules, firing several hundred grenades. During combat use, drones showed good results. The drones were able to continue operating even in conditions where losses of personnel and expensive equipment from enemy fire would have been inevitable.

The experience gained in combat use will be taken into account in the further production and development of assault robotic platforms. The combat use of such drones in Berdychi is actually similar to the first tank attack during the First World War.

A successful tracked base has great potential for developing a robotic platform for assault (installation of various combat modules) and support operations (transportation and installation of mines, removal of the wounded, transportation of cargo and equipment).

In the future, such platforms will take their place on the battlefield. Despite the fact that there are similar developments in the USA, Britain and China, it was Russia that was the first to use a group of assault drones in a real war.

The project is being implemented with the support of Boris Rozhin and Chingis Dambiev. The future has already arrived.

description: According to a survey by the INSA sociological institute, the rating of the German far-right Alternative for Germany has risen again to 20%. This comes after a series of demonstrations against right-wing radicalism in January-February, which had previously caused the rating to fall below 20%.
original:
Forwarded from: Militarist
The rating of the German far right has risen again to 20%. In January-February, a series of thousands of demonstrations against right-wing radicalism swept across Germany. Against this background, the ratings of the far-right Alternative for Germany fell below 20% for the first time in eight months. Now it has begun to grow again and for the first time in a month and a half has returned to the 20% mark. These are the results of a survey by the sociological institute INSA.

The ruling “traffic light” coalition of the SPD, Greens and FDP has only 33% in total. The conservative CDU/CSU bloc alone would have gained almost the same amount. Now it is impossible to form a new government without him, said INSA head Hermann Binkert. Among those surveyed, 63% said they were dissatisfied with Chancellor Olaf Scholz, and 73% with the work of the government.

description: Israel has legalized 'moderate physical influence' on terrorism suspects, with special departmental instructions, court decisions, and ongoing public discussion. The country's most authoritative lawyers have found justifications for this practice.
original:
Forwarded from: Signal
Most people are against torture - these are the statistics. But sociologists conducted experiments and found that if you ask not about torture in general, but propose a specific situation, it turns out that many are ready to recognize torture as acceptable. As in the famous thought experiment: a terrorist planted a bomb somewhere in a crowded place, he was caught, the bomb was not found - can he be tortured to find out where it is?

For the Israeli intelligence service Shin Bet, this is not a thought experiment, but an everyday work issue. There are special departmental instructions, court decisions on this matter, and a public discussion that has been going on for 40 years. Of course, it is impossible to directly compare the Israeli situation with the Russian one. But some parallels may still be instructive.

In the latest letter from the Signal email newsletter, we tell you how Israel has legalized “moderate physical influence” on terrorism suspects and what justifications the country’s most authoritative lawyers find for this. The Signal newsletter helps you truly understand the news. Subscribe to her at getsignal.news by Monday and we'll send you an episode on how torture is justified.

event: Import of Red Cows for Ritual Sacrifice
description: A group of Red Angus cows was imported from Texas to the occupied West Bank, sparking controversy among Israelis and Palestinians. The cows are believed to be key to fulfilling ancient Bible prophecies and rebuilding Solomon's Temple in Jerusalem, which could lead to the coming of the Messiah.
original:
Israel is set to bring red cows for ritual sacrifice to "rebuild Solomon's Temple and call for the Messiah" In the heart of the occupied West Bank, a small group of Red Angus cows has sparked controversy among both Israelis and Palestinians.

Some believe these cows, imported with great fanfare from Texas, are the key to fulfilling ancient Bible prophecies and fueling political tensions in the region.

According to Jewish tradition, the ideal red heifer was needed for ritual purification for the construction of the Third Temple in Jerusalem. The construction of this temple is the passion of some radical Jewish groups who believe that it will lead to the coming of the messiah.

However, the proposed site for this temple, the Temple Mount in Jerusalem's Old City, is also home to the Al-Aqsa Mosque and the Dome of the Rock Temple, two of the holiest sites in Islam. This convergence of religious significance has long been a flashpoint in the conflict between Israelis and Palestinians.

The arrival of these red cows did not go unnoticed by Palestinian factions.

In a recent speech marking the 100th anniversary of the Gaza war, a Hamas spokesman accused Jews of bringing red cows to the Holy Land, linking them to the ongoing conflict. Some Jews see cows as an integral part of rebuilding the ancient Jewish temple, while others see them as a provocative symbol of Israeli expansionism in the West Bank.

The transport of these cows was facilitated by Yitzhak Mamo, a member of Uvne Jerusalem, a group working to build a new temple in the Old City of Jerusalem. Mamo overcame legal hurdles to transport the heifers from Texas to the West Bank, highlighting the seriousness of their role in fulfilling Bible prophecy. They are scheduled to be sacrificed on a huge white altar overlooking the Mount of Olives in Jerusalem. This ceremony is intended to reflect the rituals of ancient times and fulfill religious prophecies.

description: The Gaza Strip's Ministry of Health reported a death toll of 32,705 and 75,200 injuries due to attacks. In the past 24 hours, 82 civilians were killed as a result of the Israeli army's actions.

event: 11th National March in Support of Palestine
description: The 11th national march in support of Palestine took place in London, attended by British trade unions, far-left parties, and student associations. The event, which began in Russell Square and ended in Trafalgar Square, drew approximately 100,000 participants.
original: The 11th national march in support of Palestine took place in London. The 11th national march in support of Palestine took place in London, which began in Russell Square and ended in Trafalgar Square. The action was attended by British trade unions, far-left parties not represented in parliament and student associations. According to the organizers, about 100 thousand people gathered, the Sky News portal reports.

description: A fire broke out in a multi-storey apartment building on Ozernaya Street in Moscow. Thick black smoke was seen pouring out of the windows. Rescuers and firefighters are on the scene, but it is unclear if anyone is inside the burning building.
original: ❗️In Moscow, a fire occurred in a multi-storey building. A fire occurred in a house located on the capital's Ozernaya Street. It is reported that the fire occurred in the second entrance of the apartment building. The footage shows thick black smoke literally pouring out of the windows. Rescuers and firefighters are working on the spot. There is no information yet about whether there are people inside the burning building.
